file_content.text: Ah. Lieutenant. I trust no more needs to be said about your work against the Migrant Merchants' Guild.
You'll find your ship in the spaceport, Lieutenant. Good luck.
You remember Senator Krasul from your meeting with the Senate earlier? Wraith kidnapped him from his home just afterward. We've tracked them to a remote space station called Port Raga.
Has Wraith made any demands? What's her objective?
What is she planning?
Our intelligence is very thin at the moment. No demands have been made as yet.
How could Wraith manage to kidnap a Republic Senator?
You've got to be joking!
Wraith was chosen for Havoc Squad for a reason. Her skills are exceptional.
I can't say I'd miss Senator Krasul's charming personality.
Who cares, he was a jerk.
It isn't your job to like him. It's your job to save him.
One of our teams is already en route to Port Raga. They'll investigate the situation and give you a detailed report on arrival.
You've already accomplished some amazing things, Lieutenant, but there's no time for a break yet. Whatever Wraith is planning, we cannot allow her to succeed. Understood?
I won't rest until the job is done.
You can count on me, General.
I know you won't, Lieutenant.
What about transport, General?
How will I get there?
No sense wasting time with more talk.
Let's get on with it.
Agreed.
Havoc Squad requires its own starship for operational flexibility. A ship has already been transferred to your command--it's waiting at the spaceport now.
I appreciate it, General.
You're the best CO ever.
Aw, you shouldn't have.
Put it to good use, Lieutenant.
I hope you're not putting me in some second-rate junker.
She'd better be fast.
I appreciate your confidence. Only the best for Havoc Squad.
Fly to Port Raga and meet with the advance team immediately. Your orders are to rescue Senator Krasul and capture or eliminate Wraith at all costs.
Good luck, Lieutenant. Dismissed.
Let's get out there and take down some traitors.
Ah, the hero of the hour. I'm proud of you, Lieutenant. You've done well.
Just doing my job.
Thank you, General.
Another promotion sounds about right to me.
Let's talk advancement.
Another promotion so soon might raise a few flags. As impressed as I am, we need to keep a low profile for now.
I know, my work is amazing.
There's no denying that, Lieutenant. But please, try not to let your self-satisfaction affect your future performance.
Defeating a legend like Jek Kardan was no small feat.
Having him alive might have been useful, but his death will strike a terrible blow to morale among the former Havoc members.
Kardan just wouldn't listen to reason.
I wish I'd gotten him alive.
Yes, but what's done is done. We need to move on to our larger goals.
I've got a long list of people left to neutralize.
Kardan was just the beginning.
You couldn't be more right, Lieutenant.
I'll make sure those traitors know who took Kardan down.
I can't wait to tell Tavus.
Then we'd better get you started, Lieutenant.
Jek Kardan walked up to the Senate tower's front door and surrendered himself in broad daylight. I never thought I'd see the day.
Kardan's help will give us quite an edge against Tavus and the others. I'm glad you could change his mind.
Do we have Kardan in a secure location?
Where is he now?
Shortly. First, we'll make sure he doesn't have any tricks up his sleeve. I haven't come this far by taking chances.
Involving an enemy in our operation might not be a good idea.
I'm not sure this is wise.
Kardan will be kept in restraints, under heavy guard at all times. Trust me, this man is the last person I would underestimate.
Kardan is more trouble than he's worth.
That old man won't be useful.
All the more reason to keep him where we can see him.
The Justicars' computer files included messages relayed between four locations. Our technicians are working to pinpoint those locations now.
There can be no doubt that the messages will lead us to the other traitors. Thanks to your efforts, we'll be able to bring them all to justice very soon.
I'm glad our plan has worked out so far.
That's good to hear.
Possibly a bit too well. One of the traitors has already moved against us: Wraith.
What are my orders in the meantime?
What happens until then?
Tavus and the others won't even know what hit them.
I can't wait.
As it happens, we've already discovered the location of one of the Havoc traitors: Wraith.
You should be down in the Works, Lieutenant. The relay station is still operational.
Apparently, Tavus and his followers are using this relay to route all of their interplanetary communications. If we destroy it, the traitors will be completely cut off from one another.
Taking the traitors down will be a lot easier if they're isolated.
I like the sound of that.
Why would the traitors depend on equipment like this?
Why risk a secret relay here?
They obviously can't rely on Republic channels, and Imperial frequencies would be useless because we could trace their source.
Tavus and his followers need this relay to keep us from overhearing their comm traffic. It's critical to their operations, which makes destroying it critical to ours.
Nobody noticed the Imps taking control of this relay? Heads better roll for this.
Why didn't we know about this?
The relay was abandoned after it crashed down to the Works and went offline during the Imperial sack of Coruscant.
According to their files, the Justicars found the relay on the surface several months ago and worked with the Imperials to rebuild it.
I'm sending Sergeant Mathin to bring you the explosives you'll need to destroy the relay. He'll rendezvous with you shortly.
I'll meet up with Sergeant Mathin ASAP.
Roger that, General.
This is my kind of mission.
If your guy doesn't get here fast, I'll never catch up to Kardan.
Mathin better double-time it.
Mathin is already en route, Lieutenant. You won't have to wait.
One last thing: Kardan didn't seem to mesh with the Imperials. I don't think he's as convinced of their supremacy as his proteges are.
You're sure to find him guarding that comm relay. Kill him if you have to, Lieutenant, but try to persuade him to surrender peacefully first.
I'll give it my best shot, General.
Will do.
Please do, Lieutenant.
What can I do to convince Kardan to come in?
Can you give me any pointers?
With all the trouble Kardan's given me, I'd rather just off him.
He's not worth the effort.
Kill him if you have to, Lieutenant, but not just because you want to. He could still be a highly valuable source of intelligence.
Kardan's only concern is the safety of the former Havoc members. He may not be loyal to us, but he isn't loyal to the Empire, either.
Convince him that it's in the best interest of Tavus's and the others for him to surrender. That's the best way to sway him.
Sounds like a plan, General.
Understood, sir.
Kardan could help us convince everyone to surrender peaceably. Make him see that, otherwise we're only going to kill them all.
Can't hurt to see if Kardan will listen to reason.
I guess it's worth a try.
Kardan won't surrender.
I know Jek Kardan, Lieutenant. Convince him that surrendering is the only way that everyone comes out of this alive, and we'll have him.
Now hurry and rendezvous with Sergeant Mathin. You'll need those explosives regardless of what happens with Kardan.
Good luck. Garza out.
Good work, Lieutenant. My technicians are accessing the Justicars' files now.
Patrol schedules, supply manifests, prisoner records--ah!
Kardan, you... I think we've found what we were looking for, Lieutenant. You have a new target.
Just tell me who and where.
I'm ready, General.
Are you saying the old man isn't my objective anymore?
What about Kardan?
Kardan is still an objective, but not your only objective.
Another target?
Kardan had the Justicars work with the Imperials to hijack and rebuild an abandoned Republic communications relay, down in an industrial area called the Works.
The Justicars' computer will tell us what we need to know, Lieutenant. Get there.
Come in, Lieutenant. Is it my imagination, or were those Imperial soldiers you just fought?
No mistake, sir. These were Imperial commandos.
That's affirmative, General.
They were Imperial soldiers, sir. Now they're corpses.
You mean killed?
You must have finally lost it, Garza.
No, you're crazy.
When I want a useless answer to a question, Lieutenant, I'll ask for it. This is serious.
Imperial soldiers, in uniform, operating on the lower levels of Coruscant--and Republic security knows nothing about it. Incredible.
We need to learn more about this link between the Justicars and the Empire. If they're hosting our enemies, they might have some useful information for us.
I'll see what I can find down here, sir. Where should I start looking?
Roger that, sir.
Shouldn't I be chasing Kardan, sir?
What about Kardan?
We need to know where exactly Kardan has gone before you can pursue him. All the more reason to search the Justicar base for information.
If the Justicars are hosting our enemies, they should be annihilated.
We should wipe these guys out.
I agree, Lieutenant. But we should learn what we can before we grind these traitors into dust.
Surveillance shows that the Justicars have their primary computer terminal in that base.
Find the necessary access card and activate that computer terminal. My technicians can then slice in and uncover everything the Justicars and Imperials have been up to.
Understood, General.
Good. Garza out.
You really think the Justicars keep data on all of Kardan's activities?
Hope they have records.
As ex-military, I'm confident that they will have all their operations and personnel well documented.
The longer I'm here, the farther Kardan can run.
That's a waste of time.
It didn't sound to me like Kardan was running. He seemed to be heading someplace specific--and the Justicars' files should tell us where.
Just find the access card for the Justicars' primary computer terminal and activate it. My technicians will take care of the rest from here. Garza out.
You have your orders, Lieutenant. Get down to the Justicars' territory and capture Jek Kardan for questioning.
First, let me congratulate you for your work on the Black Sun operation. You did well, disabling that nerve gas.
Also, that prototype blaster you confiscated will teach us a great deal about the Black Sun's sources.
Glad to be of service.
No problem, General.
Whoever the Black Sun's sources are, they're good.
That was serious hardware.
That blaster would've been a lot more useful in my hands than in a lab.
I should have kept it.
We don't know where that weapon came from, Lieutenant. Relying on it for your missions would be risky at best.
It's unfortunate that you weren't able to confirm the contents of that strange red case Sergeant Jaxo spotted--but at least the primary objective was completed.
I thought it best to focus on the immediate threat, sir.
The gas was my only concern.
In the future, I would prefer you achieve all assigned objectives.
Next time, I'll be more diligent.
It won't happen again, sir.
I would appreciate that, Lieutenant.
I'm sure there was nothing important in the case anyway.
The case doesn't matter.
Opinion noted, Lieutenant. But I wouldn't ask you to do something I didn't think was important.
As for the Senators, they weren't very happy with your testimony. "Useless" and "disrespectful" were the words they used, actually.
Just trying to keep our backs clear, sir.
Then my goal was achieved.
I only did as you requested, General.
Just following orders.
I don't believe I requested any such thing, Lieutenant. And I'm sure you'll find you don't recall me doing so, either.
Glad to hear I made an impression.
Worthless bureaucrats.
But, it's a fine line we walk, Lieutenant. Making the Senate too angry could have dire consequences.
And whatever you hoped to achieve with your Senate testimony, you certainly didn't make my job any easier.
It's my duty to tell the Senate the full truth.
I did the right thing.
This isn't about making your job easy, General.
Deal with it.
The easier my job is, the easier your job is, Lieutenant. Try to keep that in mind.
I made sure I was covered. I won't burn for you, General.
You're on your own.
Our top operators have defected to the Empire. That should be a much larger concern to you than playing it safe with a pack of bureaucrats.
On to more pressing issues. My agents have discovered a vital new link to Havoc Squad here on Coruscant.
Jek Kardan, the founder of Havoc Squad and Commander Tavus's former mentor, has been spotted on the city's lower levels. He's serving as an officer in a local vigilante group.
Is Kardan tied in with the defection, General?
Do you think he's involved?
This guy's on Coruscant, and we didn't know until now?
We're just now learning this?
No one knew where Kardan had gone. The man is a ghost.
The guy must be a hundred years old by now. Who cares what he's doing?
Big deal.
Don't underestimate this man, Lieutenant. He may not be young anymore, but he's no less dangerous for it.
Kardan resigned his commission and disappeared after the debacle on Ando Prime. If he's turned up now, it can't be a coincidence.
This guy's involved--I know it.
Agreed.
Tavus told me that Ando Prime was the reason for Havoc's defection. What happened on that planet?
What happened on Ando Prime?
We sent Havoc to Ando Prime to cut off an Imperial offensive, but the enemy numbers were much higher than intel had led us to believe.
When we tried to dispatch an extraction team, the Senate shut down the entire operation. We were "causing an incident" and "breaching the peace." Bureaucrats.
Havoc was left with no support and no way home. But in spite of insurmountable odds, Kardan led Havoc out of there alive.
What happened when the squad got back?
That's amazing.
Havoc Squad really was betrayed by the Senate.
So Tavus wasn't lying.
They were put in a terrible situation, Lieutenant, but that doesn't excuse their actions.
You left your own people to die out there!
How could you?
No. The Senate made their order very clear, and none of the Republic forces in the area were willing to disobey it.
Kardan resigned as soon as he learned the truth, and Tavus took over the squad. They were never quite the same.
What is important now is that we've discovered Jek Kardan's location. I want you to bring him in at all costs.
I'll take care of it.
Understood, General.
You don't want me to take Kardan out?
You want him alive?
I really doubt Kardan will be any use to us.
Why bother?
You just worry about getting him here, Lieutenant. His full usefulness can be determined later.
Consider Kardan neutralized, sir.
I'll end this guy.
If possible, I'd like you to capture Kardan alive. If he is involved in the defection, he could provide us with invaluable intelligence.
The vigilante group Kardan is working with is called the Justicars' Brigade. They control a large area of Coruscant's lower levels and are openly hostile to all outsiders.
These vigilantes must be pros to control that much territory.
Sounds serious.
They're very popular on the lower levels, keeping the peace where the Republic won't. But make no mistake--the Justicars are no friends to the Republic.
No problem.
Why do we tolerate these hostile groups here on Coruscant?
We put up with this?
Most areas are safe. These sectors are the last pockets of lawlessness--aftermath of the Imperial attack.
Our surveillance shows that Kardan spends most of his time in the Justicars' main base. You will attempt to capture him there.
Kardan is a crucial link to Tavus and the rest of the Havoc traitors, Lieutenant. Bring him in, no matter what it takes.
I'll have Kardan back here on the double, sir.
Understood, General.
I'm sure it won't be too hard.
Kardan led the best soldiers in the entire Republic. Don't underestimate him.
If Kardan presents a threat, I can't promise I won't kill him.
He may not give me a choice.
I understand. Just don't let your trigger finger get the better of you.
I'm counting on you, Lieutenant. Dismissed.
It's good you've arrived, Lieutenant. We have a great deal to discuss.
We can talk later, Lieutenant. Right now, you have some Senators waiting to speak with you.
Come in, Lieutenant. This is General Garza. A situation has developed with the Senate, and I need your help.
What can I do to help, sir?
Very well, General.
You need me to off a Senator or something?
A "situation," sir?
No, absolutely not--tempting as it might be at times like this.
You're on your own, General.
Forget it.
I'm afraid your help is mandatory.
Despite my best efforts, three members of the Senate Defense Committee have learned about Havoc Squad's defection, and they want to know the specifics.
It's an "informal inquiry" for the time being. But you can bet it won't end there. I hate politics.
The Senate represents the people. It's our duty to aid them.
I'll answer their questions.
That's all well and good, Lieutenant, but every moment we waste on questions is a moment Tavus and his traitors have to prepare for us.
These bureaucrats think they can question us?
Who do they think they are?
These bureaucrats control our funding and our jobs, Lieutenant. When they ask, we answer.
We don't have time for this, General.
This is ridiculous.
I'm aware of that, Lieutenant, but we have no choice in the matter.
The Senators have asked that you appear in their office at the Senate tower immediately to testify in the inquiry.
I'm barred from influencing your testimony, but I will remind you that the more information that becomes public, the harder our job becomes.
Are you telling me to lie to the Senate, General?
You want me to lie?
I never told you to lie, Lieutenant. That would be illegal. I have merely reminded you of a relevant fact.
It's my duty to provide accurate information to the Senate.
I won't hide anything, sir.
And I would certainly never advise you against keeping the Senate fully informed of our activities, Lieutenant.
The Senators won't get anything out of me.
I'll keep my mouth shut.
How you testify is your business, Lieutenant. I could never, say, show wholehearted approval of your decision beforehand.
The Senators are already waiting for you. Hurry back to the Senate tower and try to get this over with quickly. Garza out.
As if we didn't have enough problems already....
Sergeant Jaxo is still in position in the Black Sun territory, waiting to brief you. Get to it.
Let's move on to your next target: the Black Sun. A powerful organization composed of Coruscant's most violent criminals.
Black Sun has a wide network of sources providing them with the deadliest weaponry available, including a powerful nerve agent that they're selling to Tavus in bulk.
We can't let that nerve gas reach Tavus.
Then we have to stop them.
Just what is this stuff capable of?
A nerve agent?
I don't have the exact specifications on hand, but it's among the most deadly nerve gases in existence. You'll need to be cautious.
I can't believe these groups are operating on the capital of the Republic.
Coruscant is a real mess.
Coruscant hasn't been the same since the Empire's attack, just before the treaty. I suppose we're fortunate that things aren't worse.
A SpecForce sergeant, Jaxo, has carried out some advance reconnaissance of Black Sun's headquarters. You'll rendezvous with her for a detailed plan of attack.
We can't risk any of this nerve gas falling into Tavus's hands, Lieutenant. Use all necessary force. Dismissed.
Lieutenant. Congratulations again on your work against the Migrant Merchants' Guild. It was a difficult situation, and you handled it well.
Lieutenant! My orders were perfectly clear: Eliminate Krel's cyborgs.
I couldn't do it, General. I just couldn't.
I'm sorry, sir.
You had your weapon, you had them trapped and you had my orders. That should be all you need.
With all due respect, General, I could not obey those orders.
Your orders were out of line.
My orders are not polite suggestions, Lieutenant. You don't choose to follow them--you follow them.
If you want to court-martial me, Garza, you go right ahead.
I don't want to hear it.
I just might, once all of our work against Tavus is finished. If I can't trust you to follow orders, then I have no use for you.
Lieutenant, when you are on a mission, you listen to my orders, then your brain, then your heart. In that order.
There's no room for sentiment in our line of work. There should be similarly little room for it in you, or we're doomed to fail.
I'll try my best, General.
Understood, sir.
Don't try to do it, Lieutenant. Do it.
If we're heartless, what separates us from the Empire?
Where do we draw the line?
We are heartless so that the people of the Republic don't have to be, Lieutenant. So that the Republic does not become the Empire. Always remember that.
I'm always gonna do what I think is right.
I don't care what you say.
Then you won't last very long at all.
Return to my office now--we need to discuss your next assignment. Garza out.
Come in, Lieutenant. Good work. This was an unfortunate necessity, but you handled it well.
I don't feel good about it, but it had to be done.
Thank you, General.
Killing is killing, sir.
It's all the same to me.
Next time you want civilians killed, do it yourself, General.
I don't want to hear it.
We couldn't guarantee that they were civilians. The risk far outweighed the chance that we were making a mistake.
Come back to my office now--we need to discuss your next assignment. Garza out.
Those cyborgs are a threat to the Republic, Lieutenant. Deal with them.
Come in, Lieutenant. I want you to move immediately and destroy the cyborgs that Krel created.
We need to deal with them now, before they can disappear into the normal population.
These situations are never easy--these people did not choose to be what they now are. But many more lives could be at stake. You have to eliminate Krel's creations.
The threat will be neutralized.
Understood, General.
Good. I'm glad I can count on you.
I'll contact you when it's finished. Garza out.
We can't know for sure if Krel was telling the truth, sir.
What if Krel was bluffing?
Whether Krel was bluffing or not, these cyborgs are a risk we cannot allow.
These people have done nothing wrong, General!
I won't do it!
What these people have or haven't done is irrelevant. I need to prevent what they will do.
I'm giving you the kill order, Lieutenant. I take full responsibility for the consequences. Now get it done.
I'll take care of the situation.
Very well, General.
Let's get this over with.
Fine.
Killing these people is wrong, and you know it, Garza.
This isn't right.
It's right for the Republic. That's our only concern.
Garza out.
This is a waste of time. We should be going after the traitors, not gunning people down just because some madman said they're dangerous.
We do what the general said. Talking about it just wastes more time.
Orders are orders.
You're the boss.
I'm not going to murder these people. I don't care what Garza says.
We're not killing anyone.
Whatever we're going to do, let's do it fast.
Nobody asked for your opinion, Sergeant.
Shut up, Jorgan.
Corporal Garrum is in position in the old Galactic Market, Lieutenant. He'll brief you on your next assignment--destroying the Migrant Merchants' Guild's shipment of war droids.
Impeccable timing, Lieutenant. I'm General Garza. It's good to finally meet you in person.
It's an honor to be here, General.
Reporting for duty.
Did you just lie to a Senator?
What was that all about?
Certainly not. You've only just arrived and told me about Commander Tavus and the rest of Havoc Squad defecting. Before this moment, I knew nothing of the matter.
I have to congratulate you--surviving the ordeal on Ord Mantell took skill and courage. I'm impressed.
For a Special Forces general, you don't look like much.
You're supposed to be my CO?
Given what you've just survived, I'll attribute that little jewel of disrespect to stress--this time.
Speaking of which, allow me to congratulate you. You accomplished some impressive things on Ord Mantell.
Thank you, General.
All the same, you got more done than most other soldiers would have in the situation.
It's not easy being this good.
I am pretty impressive.
But I imagine the confidence comes naturally.
I don't need your approval, General.
Save your praise.
And I don't need that tone, Lieutenant. It's good that we're learning so much about one another already.
Sergeant Jorgan, I'm pleased to have you with us as well. General Vander holds you in very high regard.
Thank you, sir. But General Vander has an odd way of showing his "regard."
Vander did the best he could for you, Sergeant. And I'd say a position in the Republic's most decorated Special Forces squad is doing very well indeed.
It's regrettable about Tavus and the others. I knew they were upset, but I never imagined they would be so foolish as to defect.
Nevertheless, whatever your former squad-mates once were to us, they are now extremely dangerous enemies of the Republic.
Protecting the Republic from its enemies is our duty.
We will stop them.
If we have to kill Tavus and the others, then we have to kill them.
It seems we have no choice.
Those traitors will suffer for what they've done.
I can't wait to make them pay.
I'm glad I can depend on you to do what's necessary, Lieutenant.
So, let's load up a strike shuttle and hunt Tavus and the rest of them down like the scum they are.
I would very much like to give that order, Sergeant, but I'm afraid we've discovered some new information since you left Ord Mantell.
Things would be bad enough if we only had Havoc to deal with, but--Havoc did not defect to the Empire alone.
Our intelligence shows that hundreds of other Special Forces soldiers have followed Tavus and defected to the Empire. In short, Lieutenant, we have a catastrophe on our hands.
How do we proceed?
I can't believe so many soldiers could abandon our cause.
This is insane.
It's a dire situation. But we aren't out of options yet.
Give me ammo and body bags. I'll do the rest.
Nothing shooting won't fix.
Actually, that's not far from what I have in mind, Lieutenant.
We have one powerful asset that Tavus and his followers haven't planned for: you. Tavus believes you're dead on Ord Mantell, and that Havoc's defection is still a secret.
Right now, Tavus will be securing his armament and supplies. We need to cut those supply lines while he isn't expecting it.
Sounds like a plan.
Tavus is with the Empire, now. Wouldn't they keep him supplied?
Why would he need supplies?
The Sith Empire welcomes our defectors, but they're not going to equip men whose loyalty isn't proven. Tavus will need other sources.
We should use this opportunity to hit the traitors directly.
This is a waste of time.
Even if we knew precisely where they were--which we don't--it would be foolish to attack directly without weakening our enemies first.
In the past, when Havoc needed supplies outside of the normal Republic channels, they purchased the items from underworld groups here on Coruscant.
I have units working to cut off these underworld sources, but two organizations are proving difficult: the Black Sun and the Migrant Merchants' Guild.
I'll take care of these people for you, sir.
Let me handle them.
Can these groups really stand against us?
How tough can they be?
These aren't simple gangs, Lieutenant. They control large territories and extensive resources.
Since when are we police officers?
Is this really our job?
This isn't law enforcement. I want these people shut down, eliminated.
You'll begin with the Migrant Merchants' Guild. Our intelligence indicates that they're supplying Tavus with a full platoon of advanced war droids.
Your mission, in the broad strokes, will be to locate the droid shipments going to Tavus and destroy them.
Understood, General.
What if we let the shipments go? Then we could follow them straight to Tavus.
There's another option.
I can't risk the possibility that these items could fall into Tavus's hands.
Just mortar them all and save me the trouble, sir.
Why not shell the whole place?
This is Coruscant, not a war zone.
One of my people, Corporal Garrum, will meet you outside the Migrant Merchants' Guild's territory with the full operational details.
These missions are critical, Lieutenant. Our future success or failure is contingent on how well-supplied Tavus and his followers are.
You can count on me.
Good. The safety of the entire Republic depends on your success.
After Ord Mantell, these thugs won't even be a challenge.
This will be easy.
Don't underestimate these people. There's a reason why they've been so successful up to now, and it isn't their charming personalities.
I'd still rather be out hunting those backstabbers down.
Whatever you say.
All in good time.
I'll be observing your operations from here through your armor-cam. Good luck, Lieutenant--dismissed.
Yes, Senator, that's exactly what I'm saying. I can assure you that I've seen no shred of proof supporting these rumors of a defection within SpecForce division.
General, surely you understand, we need more than just your assurances in a matter of this--
My assurances are what you're getting, Senator. They'll have to be enough. Now if you'll excuse me, I seem to have a guest.
But Gen--
Lieutenant.
You must be lost. I can assure you this isn't the office you're looking for.
You have orders to carry out, Lieutenant. Get to it.
Now, I'm afraid there's another matter we need to discuss.
You should move on to the Black Sun territory, where Sergeant Jaxo is waiting to brief you on your second assignment.
I'm already on my way.
Roger that, General.
The party just keeps going on this planet, huh?
The fun never stops.
Hope it's worth my time.
Just get moving.
Garza out.
I don't think so, Lieutenant. Though, he might not be very cooperative if you start killing his proteges, so tread carefully.
It's time to begin your true mission. Commander Tavus and your former squad-mates have betrayed the Galactic Republic. The duty of bringing them to justice falls on you.
Have we gotten any leads on the traitors' location?
Do we know where they are?
Finally, I can go after my real targets.
It's about time.
Don't be so quick to write off your accomplishments here on Coruscant. You've definitely produced some very real results.
The Justicars' computer files included messages relayed between four locations: Taris, Tatooine, Nar Shaddaa and Alderaan. We believe the traitors are establishing operations on each of these worlds.
Your missions here severed the traitors' communications and supplies. They'll have to broadcast on other channels and reveal themselves, or stay blind and unwarned. Either way, we win.
It sounds like I'll have every advantage.
That's good to hear, sir.
A weakened enemy is the best kind.
Just the way I like it.
We may have improved your chances, Lieutenant, but this will still be no ordinary mission.
Now we'll see how they like being stabbed in the back.
They'll never see me coming.
There can be no doubt that Tavus will have former Havoc members overseeing the operations on each world. You may kill or capture them all as the situation warrants.
I'd heard that you already owned a starship when you enlisted, so I took the liberty of having it transported to the spaceport here.
I've also requisitioned a special upgrade for your ship to aid you in your mission. You'll find it on board.
One measly upgrade? Nothing else?
That's all I get?
The ship is more than adequate. It's important to stay inconspicuous.
Since you'll need your own starship, I've obtained this voucher for you. You can exchange it for the ship of your choice at the spaceport shipyard.
Couldn't you have requisitioned a sleek new warship for me?
That's all I get?
You're trying to remain inconspicuous on this mission--nondescript, commercially available vessels only.
Taris, Tatooine, Nar Shaddaa and Alderaan--four worlds, hundreds of elite soldiers and five deadly traitors to deal with. You have your work cut out for you, Lieutenant.
Tavus and the others won't know what hit them.
I'm ready, General.
When am I going to get more recruits for Havoc Squad?
My squad is still undermanned.
That may take time since we don't want Havoc's manpower shortage to become common knowledge. But you're authorized to appoint new members while in the field.
It's time you were off. I'll contact you with updated intelligence as I receive it.
I will make those traitors pay for what they've done.
Nothing could stop me.
Get to it. I'll contact you on your ship's holocom with updated intelligence as you arrive at each location.
You're dismissed, Lieutenant. Good luck out there.
Think nothing of it, Lieutenant.
We know that Tavus has purchased nerve gas canisters from the Black Sun and a platoon of advanced war droids from the Migrant Merchants' Guild.
It will be your mission to raid the two organizations' hideouts and destroy these shipments before they can reach Tavus and his followers.
My people will meet you in each group's territory with the details of your operations: Sergeant Jaxo for the Black Sun and Corporal Garrum for the Migrant Merchants' Guild.
I'll be observing your operations from here through your armor-cam. You can proceed with these missions in either order, so get to it. Dismissed.
All in good time, Lieutenant. All in good time.
Now, we've got a different situation we need to discuss.
We've already discussed your work against Krel and the Migrant Merchants' Guild, so there's no need for any further review on that operation.
